About Me
---
I'm a PhD researcher at the University of Southampton's International Centre for Ecohydraulics Research. 
I have a deep interest in how we can restore degraded habitats and their ecosystems, and make them more resilient to future shocks, particularly climate change. <br><br>
My current research focuses on chalk stream restoration monitoring - specifically of the Lower Anton Restoration Project. 
I'm seeking to expand river restoration monitoring to also consider the lateral, vertical, and temporal dimensions in more depth. 
My work spans the entire river-floodplain system, from the edge of the floodplain to the riverbed, from the groundwater to the tree canopy, and from macroinvertebrates to macrophytes.
 <br><br>
Post-PhD, I aim to continue my career as a researcher. I'm open to a wide range of research topics, whether focussing on freshwater, terrestrial, or marine ecosystems. 

::: {.research-interests}
## Research Interests

- Ecosystem restoration 
- Rewilding and nature recovery
- Climate change resilience 
- Pollution mitigation
- Interdisciplinary research
:::
